summary: This document is an email chain from August 13-15, 2019, arranging a visit by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other DOJ officials to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York to inspect the facility, including the area where Jeffrey Epstein was held, following his death. The emails discuss logistics, visitor lists, and the request that only MCC legal staff escort them due to ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is organizing and leading a visit to the MCC to inspect areas including Epstein's cell.

persons.name: Ed O'Callahan
persons.context: A Department of Justice official from Main Justice (Dal) who will be joining the MCC visit.

connections.description: Both are Department of Justice officials coordinating and participating in the same official visit to the MCC.

events.title: DOJ Visit to MCC Arranged
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other DOJ officials arrange a visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center to tour specific areas, including the psych observation/suicide watch area, the SHU, and Epstein's cordoned-off cell.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The visit was planned for shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death, with the specific intent to see his cell, which was still cordoned off.
The visiting officials requested that only MCC legal staff escort them and that they would not speak to any guards present, citing ongoing investigations.

The email chain reveals coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the Department of Justice in Washington (Main Justice) regarding the post-death facility inspection.
